US Post Offices

By Cameron Blevins & Richard W. Helbock

About Data Biography Data Processing Github Download the Data

US Post Offices

US Post Offices is a spatial-historical dataset containing records for 166,140 post offices that operated in the United States between 1639 and 2000. The dataset provides a year-by-year snapshot of the national postal system and its geography over multiple centuries, making it one of the most fine-grained and comprehensive spatial datasets assembled about US history:

US Post Offices in the Contiguous United States, 1789-2000. Darker points represent exact locations and lighter points are randomly located within their surrounding county.


  • Read the data biography detailing how the dataset was created and how it should be used.
  • Download the full dataset at Harvard Dataverse
  • You can find the code used to process and geocode the historical records in the project’s Github repository.
  • Documentation for how the dataset was processed and geocoded by Cameron Blevins

Credits

  • Richard W. Helbock (1938-2011) conducted the archival research to compile information about historical post offices.
  • Cameron Blevins processed Helbock’s data into a spatial-historical dataset and made it available online.
